tuv.seg: Your civil status affects your rights to inherit from your spouse/partner
Imríonn do stádas sibhialta tionchar ar do chearta chun oidhreacht a fháil ó do chéile/pháirtnéir
Spouses and civil partners have the same legal right to inherit and the same rights on intestacy
Tá an ceart céanna dlíthiúil ag céilí agus ag páirtnéirí sibhialta chun oidhreacht a fháil agus bíonn na cearta céanna acu maidir le díthiomnacht
A will is automatically revoked when you marry unless it was made in contemplation of that marriage
Déantar uacht a aisghairm go huathoibríoch nuair a phóstar thú, mura ndearnadh í in oirchill an phósta sin
A bequest in a will to a person who is a witness to the will or to that person’s spouse is void
Tá tiomnacht in uacht le duine atá mar fhinné leis an uacht nó le céile an duine sin ar neamhní
If you are not married, you may only inherit from your partner if you are left a bequest in a valid will
Muna bhfuil tú pósta, ní féidir leat oidhreacht a fháil ó do pháirtí muna bhfágann sé/sí tiomnacht agat in uacht bhailí
However, a spouse is entitled to what is called a "legal right share" of their deceased spouse's estate even if:
Ach, tá céile i dteideal oidhreachta ar a dtugtar "sciar dleathúil" d'eastát a c(h)éile básaithe fiú:
• there is no will
• muna bhfuil aon uacht ann
• the will is invalid
• má tá an uacht bhailí
• there is a valid will, but it leaves little or nothing to the surviving spouse
• má tá uacht bhailí ann, ach go bhfuil fiorbheagán nó tada fágtha ag an gcéile beo
The marital status of the deceased person may also indirectly affect the inheritance rights of his/her children
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh tionchar indíreach ag stádas pósta an duine básaithe ar chearta oidhreacha a c(h)uid páistí
The amount of the surviving spouse's legal right share depends on two factors:
Braitheann sciar dleathúil an chéile bheo ar dhá rud:
• whether or not there is a valid will
• an bhfuil uacht bhailí ann
• whether or not the deceased spouse has any children
• an bhfuil aon pháistí ag an gcéile a bhásaigh
You are entitled to the whole estate if:
Tá tú i dteideal an eastáit ar fad:
• there is no will or the will is invalid, and
• muna bhfuil aon uacht ann nó muna bhfuil an uacht bhailí, agus
• the deceased spouse has no children or grandchildren
• muna bhfuil aon pháistí ná garpháistí ag an gcéile básaithe
You are entitled to two-thirds of the estate if:
Tá tú i dteideal dhá thrian den eastát:
• there is no valid will, and
• muna bhfuil aon uacht bhailí ann, agus
• the deceased spouse has children or grandchildren
• má tá páistí nó garpháistí ag an gcéile básaithe
You are entitled to one-half of the estate if:
Tá tú i dteideal leath an eastáit:
• there is a valid will, and
• má tá uacht bhailí ann, agus
• the deceased spouse has no children or grandchildren
• muna bhfuil páistí nó garpháistí ag an gcéile básaithe
You are entitled to one-third of the estate if:
Tá tú i dteideal trian den eastát:
• there is a valid will, and
• má tá uacht bhailí ann, agus
• the deceased spouse has children or grandchildren
• má tá páistí nó garpháistí ag an gcéile básaithe
If you are the surviving spouse, you must be informed of this right and should apply for your legal right share as soon as possible
Más tú an céile atá beo ba cheart an ceart seo a chur in iúl duit agus ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an bpointe ar do sciar dleathúil
You may require that the family home be given to you in satisfaction of your legal right share, even if the home was left to another person under the will
D'fhéadfadh sé go ndéanfadh tú éileamh ar theach an teaghlaigh a fháil mar do sciar dleathúil, fiú má fágadh an teach chuig duine eile san uacht
If the family home is worth more than the legal right share, you will normally have to pay the difference into the deceased's estate
Más fiú níos mó ná do sciar dleathúil é teach an teaghlaigh go hiondúil beidh ort an fuílleach a íoc le heastát an té atá básaithe
However, in cases of hardship, you may apply to the court to have the dwelling house given to you either without paying the difference or by paying such sum as the court thinks reasonable
Ach, i gcásanna crua is féidir iarratas a dhéanamh chuig an gcúirt go dtabharfaí an teach cónaithe duit tríd an bhfuílleach a íoc nó suim eile a cheapann an Chúirt a bheith réasunta
Both marital and non-marital children have equal rights to inherit from their parents
Tá na cearta oidhreachta céanna óna thuismitheoirí ag páistí a rugadh taobh istigh agus taobh amuigh den phósadh
However, non-marital children may have the additional burden of having to prove paternity if it is disputed
Ach, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh an fhadhb bhreise ag páistí a rugadh taobh amuigh de phósadh atharthacht a chruthú má tá easaontas ann
Children's inheritance rights may be affected by their deceased parent's marital status
D'fhéadfadh stádas pósta a dtuismitheora tionchar a bheith aige ar chearta oidhreacha páistí
The children (minor and adult) are entitled to the entire estate divided equally between them if:
Tá páistí (faoi aois nó fásta) i dteideal eastát iomlán a dtuismitheora roinnte go cothrom eatarthu:
• there is no will or the will is invalid, and
• muna bhfuil aon uacht ann nó muna bhfuil an uacht bhailí, agus
• the deceased parent is not married or his/her spouse is already dead
• muna bhfuil an tuismitheoir a bhásaigh pósta agus/nó má tá a c(h)éile básaithe cheana
But the children are only entitled to one-third of the estate divided equally between them if:
Níl na páistí i dteideal ach aon trian den eastát roinnte go cothrom eatarthu:
• the deceased parent is married and is survived by his/her spouse
• muna bhfuil aon uacht ann nó muna bhfuil an uacht bhailí, agus
However, if a child considers that he/she has not been adequately provided for, he/she may make an application to court
• má tá an tuismitheoir a bhásaigh pósta agus má tá a c(h)éile fós beo
